name: Hide
description: Attempt to conceal yourself by making a Dexterity (Stealth) check, gaining the Invisible condition if successful
requirements: Must be Heavily Obscured or behind Three-Quarters Cover or Total Cover
Must be out of any enemy's line of sight
If you can see a creature, you can discern whether it can see you

effects.description: With the Hide action, you try to hide yourself. To do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity (Stealth) check while you're Heavily Obscured or behind Three-Quarters Cover or Total Cover, and you must be out of any enemy's line of sight. On a successful check, you have the Invisible condition while hidden.
mechanicalEffects: On success, you gain the Invisible condition
Your check total becomes the DC for creatures to find you with a Wisdom (Perception) check
You have Advantage on Initiative rolls if hidden when combat starts
Attack rolls against you have Disadvantage, and your attack rolls have Advantage
You aren't affected by effects that require the target to be seen

restrictions: Must be Heavily Obscured or behind sufficient cover (Three-Quarters or Total)
Must be out of line of sight of all enemies
Cannot hide from a creature that can see you
Hiding ends immediately if you: make a sound louder than a whisper, an enemy finds you, you make an attack roll, or you cast a spell with a Verbal component
If you attack while hidden, you reveal your location whether the attack hits or misses
examples: A rogue hides behind a large pillar in a dimly lit room
A ranger conceals themselves in dense forest undergrowth
A character uses magical darkness to hide from pursuing guards
An assassin hides in shadows before striking at their target

additionalRules.invisibleCondition: While you have the Invisible condition: you have Advantage on Initiative if Invisible when rolling; you aren't affected by effects requiring target to be seen; attack rolls against you have Disadvantage; your attack rolls have Advantage (but you don't gain this benefit against creatures that can somehow see you)
additionalRules.beingFound: Make note of your Stealth check's total, which is the DC for a creature to find you with a Wisdom (Perception) check.
additionalRules.stoppingHiding: You stop being hidden immediately after any of the following occurs: you make a sound louder than a whisper, an enemy finds you, you make an attack roll, or you cast a spell with a Verbal component.
additionalRules.bonusAction: Some class features (like Rogue's Cunning Action) allow you to Hide as a Bonus Action
additionalRules.revealingLocation: When you make an attack roll while hidden, you give away your location when the attack hits or misses
